  • java.lang.Object

extends java.lang.Object
implements Journal<E>

      • builder

        public static <E> SegmentedJournal.Builder<E> builder​()
        Returns a new segmented journal builder.
        Returns:
        A new segmented journal builder.

      • name

        public java.lang.String name​()
        Returns the segment file name prefix.
        Returns:
        The segment file name prefix.

      • directory

        public java.io.File directory​()
        Returns the storage directory.

        The storage directory is the directory to which all segments write files. Segment files for multiple logs may be stored in the storage directory, and files for each log instance will be identified by the prefix provided when the log is opened.

        Returns:
        The storage directory.

      • storageLevel

        public io.atomix.storage.StorageLevel storageLevel​()
        Returns the storage level.

        The storage level dictates how entries within individual journal segments should be stored.

        Returns:
        The storage level.

      • maxSegmentSize

        public int maxSegmentSize​()
        Returns the maximum journal segment size.

        The maximum segment size dictates the maximum size any segment in a segment may consume in bytes.

        Returns:
        The maximum segment size in bytes.

      • maxEntrySize

        public int maxEntrySize​()
        Returns the maximum journal entry size.

        The maximum entry size dictates the maximum size any entry in the segment may consume in bytes.

        Returns:
        the maximum entry size in bytes

      • maxEntriesPerSegment

        @Deprecated
public int maxEntriesPerSegment​()
        Deprecated. since 3.0.2
        Returns the maximum number of entries per segment.

        The maximum entries per segment dictates the maximum number of entries that are allowed to be stored in any segment in a journal.

        Returns:
        The maximum number of entries per segment.

      • compact

        public void compact​(long index)
        Compacts the journal up to the given index.

        The semantics of compaction are not specified by this interface.

        Parameters:
        index - The index up to which to compact the journal.
